newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Tabcorp says Carnival results in line.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Tabcorp says Carnival results in line.

text.p: Gaming and wagering group Tabcorp Holdings Ltd said results to date from the Australian Spring Carnival horse racing season from September to November are in line with the same period last year.
"So overall right as today, we are about line-ball with the same time last year," managing director Ross Wilson said at a briefing held by the Securities Institute of Australia.
"So it's not all that bad. I'm not saying it is good, we could have been between A$4-5 million up on turnover, which would have represented about A$120,000 profit after tax," Wilson said.

Wilson said the group was looking for increased revenue from the Spring Carnival but on Melbourne Cup day last week, the busiest day of Australia's racing calendar, Tabcorp's computer system crashed for about three hours.
He said the company planned to introduce a new computer next year, but the proposed new system would not be fully implemented until after the 1997 Spring Carnival.
Tabcorp shares closed six cents lower at A$5.88.
